newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks end down as bearishness continues.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks end down as bearishness continues.

text.p: Dhaka stocks slid for a sixth straight session as investors, trying to escape further losses in a falling market, kept to the sidelines, brokers said.
The Dhaka Stock Exchange all-share price index closed 85.86 points or 4.08 percent down at 2,015.10 on a turnover of 36.2 million taka on Saturday. Losers led gainers by 83 to eight.

"Retail investors are apprehending further fall during the the Ramadan (Moslem fasting month)," said one broker. Ramadan began on Saturday. Singer Bangladesh lost 993 taka to 11,976, Beximco Pharm gained two to 230 and Amam Sea Food shed 500 to 4,500.
